page.title: 12The Four Parishes.
page.content: Three parishes,Reepham,Hackford and Whitwell all meet in the churchyard. All three parishes are usually known as Reepham.Reepham has a market place so it is a town.Nearly all of the shops and pubs are set around the market place.Most people who live in Reepham live within walking distance of the market place. Some of what people call Reepham is in fact Hackford.The school and many of the houses to the west of the market are in Hackford.The rest of Hackford is farmland with Hackford Hall in the middle. In Whitwell there is a river with a mill and lots of grazing land near Whitwell Hall. Booton is just a little way out of Reepham.There is a Christmas pagent in Booton Hall every year.It is about one mile away from the town centre.
